alert.note: Alert for Lewis (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 06 at 12:27AM PST until December 07 at 5:04AM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Washington... Chehalis River Above Grand Mound affecting Grays Harbor and Thurston Counties. Newaukum River Near Chehalis affecting Lewis County. .Heavy rain over the Cascades and Willapa Hills has come to an end. Most of the rivers in Southwest Washington will crest Wednesday. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Newaukum River near Chehalis. * WHEN...Until late tonight. * IMPACTS...At 204.5 feet, deep and hazardous flood waters will inundate many roads and residential and commercial areas along the Newaukum River and its forks. Impacted roadways and surrounding areas include SR 508, Jackson Hwy. and Tune, Rush, Sommerville, Griel, Hamilton, Tauscher, Guerrier, Kirkland, Macomber, Rice, Senn, Lucas Creek, Middle Fork and North Fork, Bishop, Shorey, Labree, Gish, Yates Roads. A stage of 204.5 feet on the Newaukum roughly corresponds to Phase 3 flood in the Lewis County flood system. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:45 PM PST Tuesday the stage was 203.3 feet. - Flood stage is 202.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is forecast to crest near 204.8 feet Wednesday morning. The river will begin receding Wednesday afternoon falling below flood stage Wednesday evening. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this morning at 830 AM PST.
